instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.C1950: What is C1950? Capacitor between PP3V42_G3H & ground on pin 8 of U1950 on 2013-2015 Macbook Pros & Airs that often corrodes. When corroded, pin 8 on U1950 will be damaged, which will prevent machine from booting and cause PM_SLP_S4_L to pulse. .
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Went backwards after <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> replacement
threads.message: I had a board that turned on and would get stuck at the end of the bootup progress bar. I replaced <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>. Pin 8 and <CAPACITOR>C1950</CAPACITOR> were beat up. I cleaned up the connections a little around <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and now the board doesn't turn on anymore. Board had spill with damage limited to area around <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>. <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is not present. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> is good. 3V42 is good. I compared diode measurement in the entire <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> area to good board and nothing is off. Any ideas where this might have gone. I'm stuck with it. Not sure what I lost.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Went backwards after <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> replacement
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Went backwards after <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> replacement
threads.message: Put it in the ultrasonic cleaner.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Went backwards after <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> replacement
threads.message: Thanks for the input. They all go in there if there's any sign of spill so this one's gotten the treatment. The pictures are just for reference of original state.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Went backwards after <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> replacement
threads.message: No, I don't think I'm in that boat with this one. Nothing is pulsing.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Went backwards after <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> replacement

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Went backwards after <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> replacement
threads.message: If <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> is present then there should be a lot more rails present. Figure out which one is missing.
